revised_title: Infra-Red Dichroism and Protein Structure: A Comprehensive Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the structure of proteins, specifically focusing on infra-red dichroism and its application in understanding protein structure. The authors explore the direction of the transition moment of the carbonyl band of the peptide group and how it is influenced by mechanical interaction and orbital-following effects. They also mention the importance of X-ray analysis in studying the structure of proteins, using the example of haemoglobin molecules.
